sentences: Pole teada, kuniks meil siin asu on.
context: Kuniks is an Estonian adverb that functions in several ways: 1) It can mean 'how long' or 'for how long' when asking about duration; 2) It means 'as long as', 'until', or 'so long as' indicating a time limit or condition; 3) It appears in exclamations expressing longing for something to last (like 'Kuniks elu!' meaning 'As long as life!'); 4) It can start object clauses or time clauses. The word is versatile and context-dependent, sometimes asking about duration and other times setting limits on duration.
